thread.title: Daft Punk, A Tribe Called Quest To Perform At Grammys
thread.title_full: Daft Punk, A Tribe Called Quest To Perform At Grammys

author: Tom Breihan
title: Daft Punk, A Tribe Called Quest To Perform At Grammys
text:
CREDIT: Axelle/Bauer-Griffin/Getty Images 
Next month’s Grammy Awards may be missing a few big names , but the show has just announced an exciting new slate of performers. We already knew that Adele, Bruno Mars, Metallica, John Legend, Keith Urban, and Carrie Underwood were planning to perform at the big show. And now we know that they’ll be joined by some big, cool names. 
Daft Punk haven’t done any sort of live performance since the 2014 Grammys, when they performed with Stevie Wonder, Pharrell, and Nile Rodgers. (They won Album Of The Year at that same ceremony.) But now they’ll return to that stage for their first performance in three years, joining the Weeknd on their collab “ I Feel It Coming .” Meanwhile, a Tribe Called Quest and Anderson .Paak will perform together, presumably doing their We Got It From Here… Thank You 4 Your Service collab “Movin’ Backwards.” And the list of performers will also include Dave Grohl, Alicia Keys, and the great rising country star Maren Morris. This could be a pretty fun show! 
The Grammy Awards will air 2/12 on CBS.
